description.narrative:
IOM i Colombia har inkommit med ett förslag till den Svenska Ambassaden i Bogota om stöd för implementeringen av projektet ”Prevention of gender-based violence – second phase”, med 14 440 000 SEK under en treårsperiod.
Det huvudsakliga målet med insatsen är att bidra till implementeringen av fredsavtalet och till före detta kvinnliga Farc-kombattanters ökade politiska, sociala och ekonomiska egenmakt i sin återintegreringsprocess till civila livet. Insatsen inkluderar två specifika områden: 1) förebyggande av könsbaserat våld, och 2) främjande av kvinnors politiska, sociala och ekonomiska autonomi. Detta skall uppnås genom följande resultat: 1) En strategi för förebyggandet av könsbaserat våld implementerat i åtta regioner med deltagandet av 300 kvinnor och men (före detta kombattanter och medlemmar av samhällena) och 100 tjänstemän. 2) Åtta initiativ för ekonomisk egenmakt implementerat med ett jämställdhetsperspektiv. 3) Tre förskolor designade och fungerande som gynnar 90 barn, med deltagandet av 50 kvinnor och män i utvecklandet av handlingsplaner och kapacitetsutvecklande processer i dessa förskolor.

IOM in Colombia has submitted a proposal to the Embassy of Sweden in Bogotá to support the implementation of the project "Prevention of gender-based violence - second phase", with 14 440 000 SEK during a period of three years.
The main objective of the intervention is to contribute to the implementation of the Peace Accord and to the political, social and economic empowerment of former female combatants from Farc in their reincorporation process to civil life. The intervention includes two specific areas: 1) Prevention of gender based violence, and 2) Promotion of women's political, social and economic autonomy. This will be achieved through the following results:
1) A strategy for the prevention of gender based violence implemented in eight regions with the participation of 300 women and men (former combatants and members of the communities) and impacting 100 public servants. 2) Eight economic empowerment initiatives implemented with a gender perspective. 3) Three Care-Centers designed and functioning benefitting 90 children, with the participation of 50 women and men in the elaboration of actions plans and capacity building processes in these centers.

The main objective of the intervention is to contribute to the implementation of the Peace Accord and to the political, social and economic empowerment of former female combatants from FARC in their reincorporation process to civil life. Two specific areas are proposed: 1) Prevention of gender based violence and 2) Promotion of women, political, social and economic autonomy. It is expected that at the end of the project the following results will be achieved: 1) A strategy for the prevention of gender-based violence implemented in eight regions with the participation of 300 women and men (former combatants and members of the communities) impacting 100 public servants. 2) Eight economic empowerment initiatives implemented with a gender perspective, with an impact in the communities. 3) Three Care Centers designed and functioning benefitting 90 children. 50 women and men participate in the elaboration of action plans and capacity building processes for these Care Centers.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: Agreement Prevention of gender-based violence 2nd phase
Decision on contribution Prevention of gender-based violence 2nd phase

description.narrative: During the first year of the project and according to the work plan, only activities related with the first result area were implemented. That is: 1) A strategy for the prevention of gender-based violence implemented in eight regions with the participation of 300 women and men (former combatants and members of the communities) impacting 100 public servants. Activities related with economic empowerment initiatives and the care centers are planned for the second and third year of the project. Some of the results achieved within the strategy for prevention of gender-based violence are: 1) Eight (8) prevention plans were designed and started their implementation in the reincorporation areas (ETCRs) and in the new reallocation areas. These plans are based on a context analysis, and include strategic issues and the activities to be implemented, including communicaton campaigns. The number of participants surpassed the expected target number for the period. A total of 976 former combatants and community members participated in the activities. Of these, 647 were women and 329 men. 36,57% are former combatants and 45,18% are members of the communities which involve relatives of the former combatants. 20 public servants participated during the activities in this period. Since the total expected number of public servants to be involved by the end of the project is 100 persons, IOM will develop and implement strategies to increase their participation during June - December 2020. This will be followed-up in the committee meetings. A total of 60 activities were held in this period, which included capacity building on gender-based violence, on child care, sexual health and reproductive rights, new masculinities, communication's strategy and self-care (autocuidado). Building women's agendas and establishing attention routes for cases of gender-based violence (in line with the already ongoing governmental routes), were also part of the activities implemented. Training of trainees on new masculinities: this is implemented in alliance with Promundo-US. A working plan was developed and started its implementation in the beginning of 2020. The initial phase was the investigation and analysis on the participant's knowledge on masculinities, gender roles, care and violence, which started on March 2020. Due to the Covid-19 crisis and the lockdown established in the country, the strategies and methodologies had to be adapted to be able to continue with the process. These adaptations include a monthly bulletin with guidelines, analysis, information and activities to be implemented in the regions; Weekly seminars with the facilitators and promoters were also held to adapt the methodology and provide guidelines to continue the work online; and dialogues and consultations via whatsapp. At the end of the reporting period, all activities were held online and Promundo could gather the necessary information for their analysis.of Security risk analysis - as a result of increased murders and threats to men and women, former combatants from FARC, and social leaders during the last year, and its increase in 2020, a security risk analysis was made by IOM to analyze the security conditions in the areas where the project is being implemented and to establish the necessary actions to mitigate these risks. Two women promoters, participating in the project, have had direct threats, and actions were taken in coordination with governmental entities to lower their risks. Individual and collective measures are proposed by IOM and are being implemented. This action was not included in the initial working plan for the project but it was deemed necessary due to the deterioration of the security and the requests made by the facilitators and promoters of the project. This is a current dialogue issue and will be followed-up within the committee meetings. Environmental Perspective - As requested by the Embassy in the initial dialogue with IOM and considering that the environmental perspective of the project was weak in the project proposal, IOM developed a simple evaluation according to Sida's Green Box guidelines. As a result, recommendations were highlighted and capacity building activities have been implemented on environmental sensitivity, environmental impact analysis and mitigation, and solid waste management, among others.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
